```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)
```


# dataset
https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/tamle507/airbnb-listings-usa

```{r}
df = read.csv('./airbnb_listings.csv')
```

```{r}
# lets first remove the null values
df = na.omit(df)
```

```{r}
summary(df)
unique(df$room_type)
unique(df$minimum_nights)
unique(df$state)
```


You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
df %>%
  group_by(state, room_type) %>%
  summarise(price = mean(price)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(price, state)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = room_type)) +
  facet_grid(. ~ room_type)
  
```
